description: The project utilizes data analysis and automation to optimize restaurant operations, including predicting attendance, managing stock and staff schedules, implementing an intelligent chat service, and providing managers with real-time insights through a centralized dashboard.
details: Prediction of daily, weekly, and monthly attendance using machine learning techniques based on historical restaurant data, seasonal trends, and surrounding events.
Forecasting of stock flow to optimize orders and avoid stockouts or waste.
Automated management of staff schedules based on attendance forecasts, leave, and availability to ensure a workforce tailored to the restaurant's demand.
Implementation of an intelligent chat service capable of answering customer questions regarding the restaurant menu, ingredients, food allergies, etc.
Integration of a dashboard allowing restaurant managers to view attendance forecasts, stock levels, staff schedules, and interactions with the intelligent chat service from a single software.
Continuous real-time data collection to refine prediction models and artificial intelligence algorithms, ensuring constant performance improvement and adaptation to restaurant evolutions.

Future extension possibility to include additional features such as reservation management, integration with delivery services, etc., to meet the evolving needs of the restaurant and promote its growth.
title: Dionysas

description: Implementation of agent movement using fuzzy logic
details: Implementing a genetic algorithm to find optimal attributes for combatting enemies.
Implementing several state-space search algorithms such as A*, BFS, and DFS.
Implementing a knowledge base using Prolog.
title: Agent-oriented programming

description: Creating a handwriting recognition system that predicts English words from pen movements with over 90% accuracy, utilizing velocity vectors and various recurrent neural networks with attention mechanism.
details: Translating a sequence of 2D pen coordinates into a sequence of letters (English alphabet).
Pre-processing the data to use a velocity vector rather than coordinates.
Designing a model using various types of recurrent neural networks such as Elman, LSTM, and GRU.
Implementing an attention mechanism.
Training a model capable of predicting words written by different users with an accuracy exceeding 90%.
title: Analysis of acceleration data from a smartwatch.
Spiking neural network classifier
description: Designing a digit classifier using a spiking neural network
details: Designing and implementing simulations of the nervous system and information processing.
Integrating recent knowledge in neurophysiology and using frequency transformation of images as input to the model.

title: Auto aiming bow
description: Research on the state of the art of sensor usage in archery and implementation of a new solution to aid athletes in training
details: Training of a model capable of predicting with 87% accuracy which quarter of the target the arrow will land in.
Prediction and visualization of the shot based on the current position of the bow on a user interface visible on a computer.
Implementation of sensor data acquisition and recording using Arduino and SQL.
Design of a database enabling personalized prediction per user.
